readme:
# RocketChat-data-processor
Service for processing relevant data from RocketChat database and for publishing it to interested parties

## Overview
- `RocketChat-data-processor` service alerts the infosec team and individual users about Rocket.Chat security issues as well as provides a Maker internal channel listing and joining feature.
- The processor supports the following alerts: `2FANonCompliant`, `emailNonCompliant`, `privateRooms`, `roomJoin`.

## Alert types

- ##### `2FANonCompliant` alert sends two messages, one to the `infosec-alerts` channel and one to the non-compliant user. Users logging in with GitHub are not added in this alert.
Alert message sent to `infosec` channel:
```
These Maker employees are not 2FA compliant:
@iant
@JOEQ
```

Alert message sent to non-compliant `user`:
```
:x: This is a friendly reminder to activate 2FA on your Rocket.chat account. If you have any questions about how to do so please reachout to the #tech-ops channel.
```

- ##### `emailNonCompliant` alert sends two messages, one to the `infosec-alerts` channel and one to the non-compliant user. Users that are entitled with `Maker` role but without a `@makerdao.com` e-mail address are included in the alert.
Alert message sent to `infosec` channel:
```
These Maker employees are not MKR email compliant:
@iant
@JOEQ
```

Alert message sent to non-compliant `user`:
```
:x: This is a friendly reminder to use your Maker email address on your Rocket.chat account. If you have any questions about how to do so please reachout to the #tech-ops channel.
```

- ##### `privateRoom` alert sends one message to the `infosec-alerts` channel. PrivateRooms whose name ends in internal room flags (i.e. `-internal`) are sent along with the users who do not have the `Maker` role. 
Alert message sent to `infosec` channel:
```
These private rooms have non-Maker employees inside of them:
*marketingBrainstorm*
@outsideUser

*weekly-updates*
@outsideUser
@Cody77
@ravachol

*general-internal*
@turtleBro
```

- ##### `roomJoin` alert sends one message to the `infosec-alerts` channel when a non-Maker user joins a Maker internal channel. 
Alert message sent to `infosec` channel:
```
This private room just added a non-Maker employee:
*marketingBrainstorm*
@outsideUser
```

## Channel listing and joining
The requirements are as follows: User must be in a direct message conversation with the bot, additionally the bot must be the owner of the 'Internal Private' room. These commands will then be opperable:
- ##### `<@BOT> channels list` lists all private rooms that end with the `-internal` flag.
- ##### `<@BOT> channels join <ROOM NAME>` bot invites user to the specified private room.

## Running service
- Have to be in root folder then run `bin/hubot`

## Testing service
- Have to be in the root folder then run `npm test`
